title: The Amazing Race: Beau Ryan's cringeworthy habit on mocked by fans on Twitter
text:
The Amazing Race made its triumphant return to screens on Tuesday night.

But the thrill of watching 11 teams rush around Korea was undermined by a particularity bizarre habit of the show's host Beau Ryan.

Fans quickly noticed that the 34-year-old kept hugging contestants as they passed the pit stop at the end of the episode.

'Is he going to do that to everyone?' The Amazing Race's Beau Ryan, 34, has been mocked by viewers for awkwardly hugging contestants during Monday's season premiere

On several occasions, a handsy Beau even decided to join in on group hugs between teammates.

Fans immediately took to Twitter to mock Beau's overly-tactile behaviour, with one remarking: 'Is Beau Ryan going to awkwardly hug everyone?'

'Anyone else purely loving host whatever-his-name-is forcing his awkward hugs upon every team that reaches the pit stops?? Like.... he’s REALLY into the hugs....' mused another.

Third wheel alert! On several occasions, a handsy Beau even decided to join in on group hugs between teammates

It comes after Beau revealed what really happens between filming legs of the race as he waits for contestants to arrive at pit stops.

Speaking to 10daily on the red carpet at Channel 10's annual Upfronts this month, Beau admitted there wasn't always the luxury of time between takes.

'At the start of the race, we were waiting for a long time at the pit stops, but by the end of the race, because I was doing a lot of challenges, I was legit one minute ahead of the race,' he said.

Cringe! Fans immediately took to Twitter to mock Beau's overly-tactile behaviour, with one remarking: 'Is Beau Ryan going to awkwardly hug everyone?'

'I don't like waiting around, so it got better as the race went on, we were literally, by the last countries in Asia, we were one minute in front of the race.'

Beau, who admitted he isn't a fan of sitting around waiting for slowpokes, confessed he enjoyed the increasing pace of the race - even if it wasn't good for the producers.

The Amazing Race Australia continues Tuesday at 7.30pm on Channel Ten.
